result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karley Kathleen Bradley

defendant.name: Bradley, Karley Kathleen
defendant.address: 203 East Glen Street, Apt. #3, Crandon, WI 54520

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Karley Bradley in person with attorney John Vorhees. State by Charles Simono. State moves to DRI all counts - parties agree - Court DRI all counts.
Final pre-trial on April 27, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 12:11 PM. Called 16CF18 & 16CF20. State here for PH. Voorhees would like to hear them seperatly. 16CF20 - State calls Steven Ashbeck, 12:12 PM, State directs. Voorhees asks for sequesteration of all witness, State indicates only witness on both cases. Identification of witness, 12:20 PM. Voorhees cross examines, 12:20 PM. State - objection - sustained, 12:22 PM. State - objection - sustained - over ruled, 12:23 PM. State - re-direct, 12:28 PM. Voorhees objections - speculation - sustained, 12:31 PM. Court - finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State - files INFO, mirrors. Voorhees asks for motion that case be dismissed. Court denies motion to dismiss. State moves to enter exhibit #1 into case, no objections. Court accepts exhibit #1. Voorhees has information and waives further reading, proceed to ARGN. Voorhees enters NG pleas to all counts, indicates has not received all discovery and asks for extension of time. State does not object. 14 days from reciept of discovery to allow filing of motions. Court will adjourn until 1:30 PM to here the PH on 16CF18, Adjourned, 12:36 PM. Final pre-trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:42 PM. 16CF18 - State - has made offer through Voorhees, have an agreement amending to misd. charges, providing she does not reoffend and with that agreement will waive PH. Court goes over waiver of PH form, finds the defendant is freely and voluntairly waiving her right to PH. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State has filed INFO, mirrors. Voorhees has copy and waives further reading, proceed to ARGN, enters NG pleas. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
From attorney, requesting adjournment for PH. Approved by Judge.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:10 PM. Voorhees and Bradley have both complaints, waives reading of them, requests PH on both matters, will waive time limits. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond on both cases, sets both matters for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Karley Kathleen Bradley
Current: 203 East Glen Street, Apt. #3, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 01-14-2016)
Prior: 603 North Hazeldell Avenue, Crandon, WI 54520
No consumption of alcohol and no contact with Marcus Morris except for issues related to their child in common.

Defendant Karley Kathleen Bradley in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:05 AM. Also called 16CF20. Bradley has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties for both cases and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Bradley understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, asks for signature bond for stated reasons. Court instructs defendant to contact SPD today. Court believes the defendant is eligible for SPD. Court sets for AIA. State - bond - asks for clarification of the defendant's address. Bradley - states that the address stated by the State is her mom's address, states her address is 203 East Glen Street, Apt. #3, Crandon, WI. Defendant made statement in regards to where she could live if she gets a signature bond. State - bond - $500 cash bond on each case and no contact with co-defendant in each file. Court - bond - $250.00 cash on each case, no consumption of alcohol, no contact with Marcus Morris. Court can re-address bond if the defendant can't post the money.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.
